Class MatrixOperations

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.util.MatrixOperations
public class MatrixOperations extends Object
A stateless utility class providing core matrix manipulation algorithms for the game.

This class encapsulates the low-level mathematical operations required for a grid-based game, including:

  • Collision Detection: Checking if two matrices overlap (intersect(int[][], int[][], int, int)).
  • State Merging: Locking a brick into the background grid (merge(int[][], int[][], int, int)).
  • Row Logic: Detecting and clearing full rows (checkRemoving(int[][])).
  • Deep Copying: Ensuring data integrity for immutable objects.

By separating these algorithms from SimpleBoard, the code adheres to the Single Responsibility Principle: the Board handles game rules, while this class handles the math.

    • MatrixOperations

      public MatrixOperations()

  • Method Details

    • intersect

      public static boolean intersect(int[][] matrix, int[][] brick, int x, int y)
      Checks if a brick collides with the board boundaries or existing blocks.

      This method iterates through the non-zero cells of the brick matrix and verifies if the corresponding target cells on the main board are occupied or out of bounds.

      Parameters:
      matrix - the background board grid.
      brick - the 4x4 matrix of the falling piece.
      x - the top-left X coordinate of the brick.
      y - the top-left Y coordinate of the brick.
      Returns:
      true if a collision is detected; false otherwise.

    • checkOutOfBound

      private static boolean checkOutOfBound(int[][] matrix, int targetX, int targetY)
      Helper method to validate grid coordinates.
      Parameters:
      matrix - the board grid to check against.
      targetX - the column index to validate.
      targetY - the row index to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the coordinates are outside the valid grid dimensions.

    • copy

      public static int[][] copy(int[][] original)
      Creates a deep copy of a 2D integer array.

      Used extensively throughout the application to enforce immutability in data transfer objects (like ViewData).

      Parameters:
      original - the source matrix.
      Returns:
      a new, independent copy of the matrix.

    • merge

      public static int[][] merge(int[][] filledFields, int[][] brick, int x, int y)
      Merges a brick into the background grid.

      This creates a new board state where the active brick's cells are written permanently onto the background matrix. Used when a piece locks in place.

      Parameters:
      filledFields - the current background grid.
      brick - the matrix of the brick to lock.
      x - the x-coordinate of the brick.
      y - the y-coordinate of the brick.
      Returns:
      a new 2D array representing the merged state.

    • checkRemoving

      public static ClearRow checkRemoving(int[][] matrix)
      Scans the matrix for full rows, removes them, and shifts remaining rows down.

      This implements the core Tetris line-clearing mechanic. It uses a Deque to efficiently rebuild the matrix from the bottom up, excluding full rows.

      Parameters:
      matrix - the board state to check.
      Returns:
      a ClearRow result containing the cleared line count and the new matrix.

    • deepCopyList

      public static List<int[][]> deepCopyList(List<int[][]> list)
      Deep copies a list of 2D arrays.

      Used by Brick classes to return safe copies of their internal shape data.

      Parameters:
      list - the source list of matrices.
      Returns:
      a new list containing independent copies of each matrix.
